36#include "krb5_locl.h"
37
38int _krb5_AES_SHA1_string_to_default_iterator = 4096;
39
40static krb5_error_code
41AES_SHA1_string_to_key(krb5_context context,
42 krb5_enctype enctype,
43 krb5_data password,
44 krb5_salt salt,
45 krb5_data opaque,
46 krb5_keyblock *key)
47{
48 krb5_error_code ret;
49 uint32_t iter;
50 struct _krb5_encryption_type *et;
51 struct _krb5_key_data kd;
52
53 if (opaque.length == 0)
54 iter = _krb5_AES_SHA1_string_to_default_iterator;
55 else if (opaque.length == 4) {
56 unsigned long v;
57 _krb5_get_int(opaque.data, &v, 4);
58 iter = ((uint32_t)v);
59 } else
60 return KRB5_PROG_KEYTYPE_NOSUPP; /* XXX */
61
62 et = _krb5_find_enctype(enctype);
63 if (et == NULL)
64 return KRB5_PROG_KEYTYPE_NOSUPP;
65
66 kd.schedule = NULL;
67 ALLOC(kd.key, 1);
68 if (kd.key == NULL)
69 return krb5_enomem(context);
70 kd.key->keytype = enctype;
71 ret = krb5_data_alloc(&kd.key->keyvalue, et->keytype->size);
72 if (ret) {
73 krb5_set_error_message (context, ret, N_("malloc: out of memory", ""));
74 return ret;
75 }
76
77 ret = PKCS5_PBKDF2_HMAC(password.data, password.length,
78 salt.saltvalue.data, salt.saltvalue.length,
79 iter,
80 EVP_sha1(),
81 et->keytype->size, kd.key->keyvalue.data);
82 if (ret != 1) {
83 _krb5_free_key_data(context, &kd, et);
84 krb5_set_error_message(context, KRB5_PROG_KEYTYPE_NOSUPP,
85 "Error calculating s2k");
86 return KRB5_PROG_KEYTYPE_NOSUPP;
87 }
88
89 ret = _krb5_derive_key(context, et, &kd, "kerberos", strlen("kerberos"));
90 if (ret == 0)
91 ret = krb5_copy_keyblock_contents(context, kd.key, key);
92 _krb5_free_key_data(context, &kd, et);
93
94 return ret;
95}
96
97struct salt_type _krb5_AES_SHA1_salt[] = {
98 {
99 KRB5_PW_SALT,
100 "pw-salt",
101 AES_SHA1_string_to_key
102 },
103 { 0, NULL, NULL }
104};
105
